website_summaries.verdict: Corded variable speed nail grinder that works for all size pets, though it takes longer with big dogs.
pros: Variable speed to suit your needs
Corded model, so battery drain is a non-issue
Powerful enough for big dogs and tough nails

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy this one again.  Just buy a wired dremel with variable speed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to keep it but I wouldn't buy it again. I just moved and can't find my Dremel tools so I needed something for now. I thought I may as well buy one that is made for dogs nails and is powerful and quiet. It's not very powerful unless you turn it all the way up in which case it is as loud as my 110V dremel tool. When you have it turned up to about 1/2 way or full out, it sounds like it is going to fall apart with all the rattling. I'm too lazy to return it and haven't found my Dremel yet so I'll keep it and use it as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: hakosama

customer_reviews.title: Love this nail grinder for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful tool for usong im my 2 Boxers nails. This is my 2nd one. Our first one was still going strong for 5.5 years but i dropped it on our concrete basement floor and it broke. So i went to the Amazon website and bought another. Well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: SMSGTLISA

customer_reviews.title: Great nail grinder for dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific nail grinder. My dog hates the clippers and freaks out if you try to use them on him. He does not do well at the groomers who prefer clippers over grinders. They prefer to clip away so I had to invest in a nail grinder. I had another brand which lasted about a year before the bit holder gave away. This one has adjustable speeds and did the job very quickly which is the goal, to minimize the time for dogs that are fussy about their paws. I like it you don't have to keep it outside to juice up before using them. Just plug and it's ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper1

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect nail grinder for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Oster Professional Nail Grinder kit I have purchased. I had the first one for 9 years. I like the variable speeds which are easily adjusted during application. The high speeds are very high and the noise does step up. The size and weight are comfortable to hold. The charger is of a newer design and the cord is appreciatively long. It is just the right size for easy holding. Another plus is the carrying case. As with all electric grinders, one should grind nails in small spurts. If held too long the heat build-up is fast and painful to the pet's nail.
customer_reviews.author: KMA

customer_reviews.title: Great for a month only! Find Another
customer_reviews.text: Great product when it worked. Within just over a month there was a short in the wire that went into the grinder. Now it quit working. And we are past time to return. It was a Christmas gift for my wife who is the best dog groomer in central Illinois. A shame because she likes how it works but not dependable.
customer_reviews.author: William R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Nail Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is the best nail grinder I have found. Had my other one for about 8 years, and it still works great, but bought another one just in case it goes out. It gets a lot of use. My dogs hate having their nails trimmed, but they will let me grind them down without any problems. Less stress for them means less stress for me. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased. My pooch took to it right away with ...
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. My pooch took to it right away with little fuss. I can't bring myself to trim his nails but I sure can grind them. His nails are too long and this grinder is very convenient and effective. It will take a while to get them to where they should be. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Westie

customer_reviews.title: I have already paid myself back for the cost of this tool by doing it on my own and my dog is much more happy than with regular
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver with my dog who has very sensitive front paws. I take him to the groomer to have the groomer do the exact same thing with him but it's expensive. I have already paid myself back for the cost of this tool by doing it on my own and my dog is much more happy than with regular nail trimmers
customer_reviews.author: Teresa R Britt

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is easy to use and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several battery type grinders and then switched to this one. It is very easy to hold and easy to use. The grinding wheels are easy to change and you don't even need a tool. I have a very large dog and a very small one and it works great for both.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: These have a smooth feel and are quite when using.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my dog spa in my business. The low noise when using them definitely helps when using them to give a smooth finish on dogs nails. Reasonable cost with a high quality product is something everyone appreciates.
customer_reviews.author: Okimb

customer_reviews.title: it works much better than cordless ones
customer_reviews.text: it works much better than cordless ones. instructions are little unclear how to attach and detach the heads but it's easy to figure out once you fiddle with it for a minute or two. speed dial is awesome! my dog is little confused what's cooking by grinding smell but all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Toejam

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not spend the money. Buy a craftsman instead for the same price. This dremmel has no power, it is horrible. Just stops right in the middle of grinding. Won't stay tight no matter how tight you get it. Had to re tighten 6 times for one dog!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not great. The speed is really too slow for nails ...
customer_reviews.text: This works okay, not great. The speed is really too slow for nails and it's very noisy. I have a dremel nail grinder that works very well, but the rechargeable batteries seem to fail every other year. I thought this might be a good replacement, but it's not. It's good enough that I will keep it at our vacation home, but I wouldn't want it to be my only nail grinder. Haven't found the perfect dog nail grinder.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Best by far.
customer_reviews.text: Long cord, easy to use, comfortable hold and the speed adjustment is a great feature. I've purchased other dog dremel's that were battery operated. The batteries would not function the same over time. Having a cord is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They hated having their nails done because they didn't trust the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two small chihuahuas and was spending $20 to have their nails trimmed every few weeks. They hated having their nails done because they didn't trust the girl (not her fault, I have finicky dogs) at the pet store. Both dogs let me use the grinder on their nails without trouble. I love that it has a dial to adjust the speed. It does take a little time only because neither dog is comfortable with a higher speed setting right now. I have already recommended this grinder to several people I know.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, easy to use, multiple speeds, convenient, worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our dog, she hates having her nails clipped but she lets us sand her nails down, is quiet and doesn’t scare her at all! I love the different speeds. Great product wish I would have had this for our first dog :)
customer_reviews.author: Journey09

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool to have!! ....But a little loud!
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use and hold. Works when you apply pressure. Wish that it would have a little more strength from the get go when you turn it on. Have to really edge it right to not spend forever on a nail. The motor is really loud. Wish the motor was more quiet especially for the animals. It is better to have it plugged in than my cordless one though. The cordless one dies too fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 60 lb. goldendoodle, and we are able to file down his nails in less than 5 minutes. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: TDD

customer_reviews.title: Powerful nail grinder for our big doggies
customer_reviews.text: Great and powerful nail grinder for our 3 dogs. We tried it out for the first time on all of them. They are scared of the sound though. But I'm hoping they will get used to it.... little chickens.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to assemble the grinder and stem.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. Yes, it works, BUT I watched the you tube video, and the stem of the grinder still sticks waaay out too far no matter how many times I take it out and reinsert! They make it look so easy to install, but It. Is. Not!
customer_reviews.author: shopper48

customer_reviews.title: I love this nail grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love this nail grinder. It works smoothly and doesn't upset my dogs. Some people have said it stops grinding if you put pressure on it but you should not need to use pressure. Just let the grinder do its work. I had a Dremel that I loved but it died after many years of use. I like this one much better because it has a cord and it runs more smoothly. It would be nice if it had a grinder head that was smaller in diameter for small dogs though.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Witting

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for grooming
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool for grooming my puppy. Charlie is part ShihTzu and part wild thing and extremely sensitive. I put her tummy side up on a pillow and she allows me to file/grind her nails. She is a little skittish, but every week a little more adapted.
customer_reviews.author: candydar

customer_reviews.title: Great product for quiet and quick nail grinding!
customer_reviews.text: My pooches love this nail grinder - it's quiet yet powerful, so it works quickly. The cord is extra long and it is small enough for me to handle (i have small hands). I use it weekly on my morkies and have had much success! highly recommended :)
customer_reviews.author: cfcreate

customer_reviews.title: Great power. Would but again
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Works great on my 4 large dogs. Better than clipping nails. Black nails make me nervous to cut because I'm always afraid of quicking the dog but im less likely to hurt the dog using the nail grinder. Just have to use good judgement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my 5 one
customer_reviews.text: They all last about a 1 year, Is loud, most dogs get scared of the noise, after few mouths start problems with the switch, Non of them last long then 1 year and this is no repair service for this device .......
customer_reviews.author: A . S

customer_reviews.title: Failed speed control after very little use.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in 2009 and used it just two or three times. Five months ago we started grooming our Wheaten ourselves, so we were glad we had a nail grinder. Yesterday on the third paw the speed control failed. It went to a double full speed way faster (noiser, louder) than the fastest speed. The speed control now has no effect. It's just too jarring to use now. Our Wheaten seems to be ok with it, but we're not. All in all, it probably was used five times when it went bad.
customer_reviews.author: Senior Couple in Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Instruction booklet has limited operating information
customer_reviews.text: The nail grinder comes with a nice storing case. However, the instruction booklet very vague & brief. Have no idea how to safely change the tool or use it.
customer_reviews.author: Janell1975

customer_reviews.title: Much safer than tradition trimming!
customer_reviews.text: I have always preferred a grinder to nail trimmers for my Vizsla dogs. Although it may take a bit longer and require some dog training/conditioning, it is much safer because the risk of cutting the nail too short and causing pain and bleeding is virtually eliminated. A great feature of this product is that it has a cord that plugs in rather than the less powerful options that utilize batteries. With a bit of positive reinforcement and training, nail trimming is no longer an awful experience for dog or owner.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Deanne

customer_reviews.title: good quaility
customer_reviews.text: very adjustable in power, nice long cord. only used once so far it will take the dog a little while to get use to but will work out very good.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa m clarkAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solved my issues.
customer_reviews.text: Have been trimming my different dog nails for 50. years and this is the first one that has not scared my dog. it has adjustable torque so if you adjust it correctly if you slip off the nail it slows and the shape gave better control.
customer_reviews.author: Bluewhale

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a nice small size and so easy to control. I've used wireless versions (which had trouble holding a charge) that felt very bulky and were much harder to control. Even my previous wired nail grinder (different brand) was much more difficult to control due to its size. I had no idea what I was missing out on until I tried this one! It's just perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Lachri

customer_reviews.title: Safer than clipping
customer_reviews.text: Once my pet became used to the whrrrrrr-ing noise of the grinder, I have been able to keep his nails filed to an acceptable length without too much objecting by him. I feel it's a lot safer than trying to clip his nails and risk cutting the quick, causing pain.
customer_reviews.author: Lee N. from Portland, Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Good product...
customer_reviews.text: I had an Oster grinder for years. But it finally gave up. I like this item and it is less evasive than "guessing" where the animals quick is.
customer_reviews.author: SM-Tx, USA

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but somewhat fragile
customer_reviews.text: We have four dogs, and they have black nails, so cutting them inevitably ends up getting some of the quick on at least one of the nails. Grinding is slower, but you can stop before you hurt the dog. This grinder is great for doing the dog's nails, it's small enough to be able to maneuver but powerful enough to do the job. The only complaint I have is that it is somewhat fragile, and if you drop it the electronics seem to go bad and it won't run anymore. (I know - then don't drop it!) I like it enough that I'm on my third one, but still...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no so sturdy !
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through 3 of these in the last 2 years... They work great, but durability sucks
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Crippen

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend this; noise is a factor all pet owners ...
customer_reviews.text: My little Min Pin is frightened of this because it is very loud! I was unable to get it sent back because of illness, so I guess it is mine. Can't recommend this; noise is a factor all pet owners and groomers need to be very aware of.......stress is not good when getting nails trimmed and it has too be done often for the physical comfort of the pet.
customer_reviews.author: Maddierae

customer_reviews.title: It fit
customer_reviews.text: I liked the first one I had but it was too well used and I needed another.
customer_reviews.author: Jesseca Grim

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT Last
customer_reviews.text: Not even a year just doing dog toenails!! Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: KPP

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how it would work on our 137 lb English Mastiff, but my fears were unjustified. Following the directions, we let her see it for a few days, listen for a few days, touch her with it for a few days prior to trimming her nails. It worked great. Her nails are extremely large and thick, and the grinder didn't slow down a bit. The Vet said they were as nice as she could have made them look. I recommend this product to anyone who doesn't have a dog with touchy paws.
customer_reviews.author: Mom & Pop of the Groom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: received on the 31st of January- on the 28th of April, just shy of 90 days, the thing quit. Worked fine earlier, tried it around 2.00 pm. would not turn on. Don't know if it's the switch, the plug or the whole unit, but we can no longer use the item, since it won't turn on. Since this is advertised as "Professional", it should last longer than 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: A F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Was very impressed with this product. I was about to buy the one you see advertised on TV all the time. Logged into Amazon and saw it had horrible reviews. Saw this one with excellent reviews and am very happy with it ! It does the job and does the job WELL ! My little chihuahua is well..a typical nervous chihuahua. My wife was able to grind down his nails with ease. The 1st time he did not like it too much, but the SECOND time around....he let her do it and was easy. Great product !
customer_reviews.author: Firstinlastout

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dog’s groomer and she loves it. Says it’s the best one she’s ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Oster Pet Nail Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product over the cheaper "Pedi-Paws" as I wanted something that could handle the substantial nails on my shepherd-rottie mix. This looked like it would do the trick and it does. While I wouldn't go so far as to say my dog enjoys these sessions, she does tolerate them. I have been doing short, but frequent sessions to get her accustomed to it. In any event, it is much better than hacking off the nail, and possibly the quick as well!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Caplan

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient, quiet
customer_reviews.text: I have two puppies and was looking for a good way to trim their nails that would also be gentle (i.e. not crack their nails), I found this set. It is easy to use and changing out the grinding stones is self explanatory. It took my dogs some time to get used to it but now it takes hardly any time to shorten their nails to a reasonable length. However, I still occasionally grind into the quick accidentally, perhaps some kind of stop to prevent this? Overall, great product though.
customer_reviews.author: P. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great for Doggie Toenails!
customer_reviews.text: this is so much better than using clippers.. I can get them shorter than usual because I don't fear quicking them.
customer_reviews.author: Billies

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: It okay. My pet still hates his nails done no matter what. If you go to short they feel the heat so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Joycee

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: We have two chihuahuas who are big babies when it comes to having their nails clipped. I have used the Oster grinder a few times now. They don't get nearly so hysterical now. I would say the "drama" factor has decreased from a 9 to a 3. I have had two minor problems with the grinder. One, attaching the head is a little tricky. It takes me two or three tries before I get it locked in correctly. Second, the sand paper ring tends to slip. Keep an eye on it.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Dean

customer_reviews.title: So much better than clippers--But Didn't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: Can't imagine why we waited so long to switch to a grinder from clippers. The product does exactly what it is supposed to do. The only downside is the lack of instructions relating to which grinding wheel to use. However, there is plenty of information available on line for first time nail grinders. Our lab is happy. Update: Unit quit working after about a dozen uses... after warranty ended though. That's a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: overall good
customer_reviews.text: Theworks well overall. I like the variable speed and its power. It's far superior to the battery run one heavily advertised which doesn't have the power for medium and larger breeds or any dog (animal) with thick, hard nails. Beware those with long-haired dogs. The shaft catches easily on their fur. Were I to buy another grinder, it would be one with the guard over the shaft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to "start from the bottom" and work your way up (as the directions say to) without touching the dog's pads at all with the nail grinder. Also, it's nearly impossible to get the right angle to file the dewclaw. As stated previously, it takes a lot of patience. If you and your dog have got the time, I suppose you may have better luck than me. I'd rather pay $10 for the vet to trim my dog's nails than to hassle with this nail grinder again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ontiveros

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best nail grinder! Drills down my dobermans nails in minutes! The drill noise isn't that loud either!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: wow love this so much ...it works awesome best feature of this product is the dial for the speed that is the best part. Better then other devices which only have one or two speed settings. LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: I received my Oster Pet Nail Grinder yesterday. I was not happy to open the box and see that the sanding disks must be old enough and dried up, as they've started to peel apart. They'll need to be replaced as they can't be used that way. Also, the directions included with this product are not very detailed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Originally I thought I received a dud. Turns out this product has to be charged before first use. Another hiccup is that sometimes the bit does not seat easily in the trimmer. I had to fight with it a little bit while depressing the button that supposedly locks it in place. The grinder works best/most safely (prevents burning pet's nails) at the higher speeds. I gave this nail grinder three stars because of the difficulty seating the bit and for its noisy operation at the high speed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Helbling

customer_reviews.title: Nothing
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful. I use it on my dogs nail and it is great
customer_reviews.author: Marleen Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Paws
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grinder. I start using a grinder on my dogs when they are very young pups, 7 to 8 weeks old. This way they are used to the buzzing sound and just lie still on their side when I do the nails. Most times they just fall asleep when they get their pedicure.This is the second Oster grinder I have purchased. I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: DOBE LADY

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a miniature poodle who has been extremely difficult when it comes to nail trimming. I tried everything to get Molly calmed down from giving her calming medication, treats, to rubbing her feet daily, etc. but none of these methods worked. I ended up having professionals clipped those nails and I knew what an ordeal Molly must have had during those episodes. I bought the Oster Nail Grinder and tried it on Molly, at first she was very nervous about it but after securing feet, I turned up the speed and the grinder went to work. It took less than eight minutes to get all 16 toes trimmed! The impossible finally became possible! I was absolutely amazed!
customer_reviews.author: Dmarie

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: owned one before and needed a new one. works great
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Wish I knew what and how to use the stone grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Best Nail Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Oster is good quality and this is yet another example of that. There are a ton on the market so I went with a name I could trust, and am very pleased with my decision. I have an American and an Olde English Bulldogs. I pulled this thing out of it's package and one by one flipped them over and started filing away. I was impressed at how well it worked and how easy it was to use. I will never use harsh clippers or pay to get my dogs nails done ever again!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have a doberman who got frostbite. When we tried to clip his toes they would just crack and chip. This nail grinder is perfect. It has adjustable speeds and extra sanding elements so that I could choose the one I thought would work best. He is all sanded up and walking without a limp now. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne Cooper

customer_reviews.title: SCARY for your pet
customer_reviews.text: "Speed Control" does not work. It goes from super slow to ridiculous fast and adjusting the speed does not work. Also, it is very loud. My dog has a hard time with his paws being touched and he allows me but when I used this device he was more shy than ever. DO NOT waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mariza Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: It works very good, my dog is a Dachshund, she tolerated the vibration and it filed the nails nicely. I do recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oster Nail Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I will say this item does save money. Everytime I do my dogs' nails I think of how much I am saving by not going to the vet and paying $15 per dog. It's a corded drimmel, like my husband has in his workshop. But, I keep this one stored away and clean, so that I have it when I need it. It does take some practice to get the dogs used to the noise.
customer_reviews.author: J. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job, but the switch is inconvenient and easy to turn off by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Err

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the first grinder I bought
customer_reviews.text: This is my second and after 3 months it is already changing speed when used. My first one lasted almost 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: cookie lady

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to work with and very quiet doesn't scare the dogs
customer_reviews.author: Judy M.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just don't have the hang of this yet ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just don't have the hang of this yet, but I can't figure out taking the bit in and out...it always seems loose...
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra White

customer_reviews.title: me
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product for taking the nails off my dogs. I had gotten to the point of not wanting to attempt trimming his nail with the clippers for fear of cutting the quick (did a couple of time). Now other than it tickling may dogs toes I can get it done effortlessly without pain and the blood from cutting to close. My dogs and I are all happy.
customer_reviews.author: lleweck

customer_reviews.title: All HATE nails being clipped
customer_reviews.text: Tolerated by all 7 of my dogs really well. All HATE nails being clipped, this is smooth and doesn't take nail down too fast but much better than battery powered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but takes a while and is EXTREMELY loud. I knew my dog wouldn't like this process but the extra noise definitely didn't help. All in all with the case it comes with worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Nietert

customer_reviews.title: Its not bad....just noisy
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the power it does have. But as a professional groomer I would not use it for work. It's too loud for a lot of dogs I work with and they will panic. But it works well in the house use only for your own dogs. My German Shepherd does not mind it
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Mobile pet grooming dog toenail trimmers
customer_reviews.text: My wife's mobile pet groomer she had these less than a year and didn't work anymore
customer_reviews.author: john johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nail Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Works great, be sure to trim the hair of your dogs feet before you use this. Quiet motor so my dog doesn't freak out when I use this on her. Nice to trim nails and have them smooth instead of sharp like when you use a clipper.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use to have a Pet-a-cure that did not have sufficient grinding speed and a guard so you could only flat grind the nail (it would still have sharp edges). The Oster pet nail grinder has a variable speed and with the open end you can shape the nail and not leave any sharp edges. Best grinder I have used. I really like having a convienamt case, easy to pack with while on vacation (since grooming does not ever take a vacation).
customer_reviews.author: laurie morrow

customer_reviews.title: works great on my jack russell terrier
customer_reviews.text: she hates clippers but doesn't mind this at all once she got used to the noise. on her nails it does its work quickly and without any trouble. the adapter is very heavy but i plug it into a power strip where its weight is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Pelic

customer_reviews.title: On my 2nd one!
customer_reviews.text: I first bought the nail grinder not knowing if it would work. After watching my dog bleed from a clipping (thank GOD I had the powder to make the bleeding stop), I knew clipping was no longer an option. I bought my first one about 8 years ago and have loved it ever since. Easy to use! I recommend you getting your dog "use" to the LOUD sound of the machine. Maybe Oster is reading this and will make a grinder in the future "a little less noisy". Pet owners....best investment if you own a dog!
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it as much as the can - mostly because ...
customer_reviews.text: It works. Dogs love it as much as the can - mostly because it reduced the nail trimming from 30 minutes of battery powered drudgery to 5 minutes of bang done.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old one. Lasted 11 yrs. Good quality and easy to use. Arrived on time. Just wished they rung the doorbell. They just left it. Didn’t want to be on camera?
customer_reviews.author: K. HIGA

customer_reviews.title: Maybe skip it
customer_reviews.text: The diagram of the grinder did not show some of the parts, so I had to fool around with it to figure out how to lock the grinding stone in corectly. It does a good job grinding, but of course my dogs are sort of freaked out by it. They do not mind getting their nails done with a clipper, so I think I will clip them the regular way, and maybe just do a quick grind of the ends. If your dog hates to have his nails cut, this will probably make them panic.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. I wish the motor was stronger but I guess it works out because when the dog moves and the grinder hits my nail, it doesnt do much damage. Only problem is that it still takes a considerable amount of time to do. I have to take breaks to let the dog rest.
customer_reviews.author: Lilah

customer_reviews.title: same one the vet used
customer_reviews.text: I have a older large dog whose nails are very hard to clip. The vet used one of these on his last visit. It worked well and he didn't mind it at all. I got my own and now avoid the hassle of bringing him in and the $25 charge. Works great . Wish I had gotten this years ago
customer_reviews.author: paula collums

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The oster grinder is pricier than other pet nail grinders, but it is a trusted name. I found the grinder very easy to use. My dog did not mind at all. My cat prefers the clippers. This grinder comes with a very sturdy case. It has met or exceeded all my expectations. I have not tried any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Shug

customer_reviews.title: Claws overgrone, and to hard to cut!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Have a new Doberman, rescue. She looked like her claws had never been clipped, and I didn't know if she would let me use the grinder? But thank god she just lay there and let me do her claws, it will take some time to get them down to what they should be, but we are on the way. Thank you all, and Oster
customer_reviews.author: Joann M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: maybe ok for smaller breeds
customer_reviews.text: Your dog needs to be ok with the sound of nail grinding or it won't work. I have medium sized breeds and I felt I could have used more power to effectively and in a timely manner, grind my dogs' nails. This is sitting in a drawer right now.
customer_reviews.author: oops

customer_reviews.title: Prepare for loudness!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but the thing ids so loud my poor dogs shiver through it all!
customer_reviews.author: Ginni Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Great Job-Dog Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and very easy to use. Our dogs sit very still for it. Just make sure you have a towel underneath when doing this to catch the dust from their nails.
customer_reviews.author: APalad

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job on poodles, whippet and an English Setter.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Apap

customer_reviews.title: she did not like nail clippers had to take her to vet to ...
customer_reviews.text: my dog holds still for this ,she did not like nail clippers had to take her to vet to have it done .with the grinder I can do it at home .
customer_reviews.author: JML

customer_reviews.title: works great. This is my second time buying this product
customer_reviews.text: works great. This is my second time buying this product. I use it every other week and never have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Oster dogs nail grinder
customer_reviews.text: Very good article ! Earlier I had the other one grinder made in China but it worked only 2 times. This is also made in China but the quality is much better. I can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danguole Kamarauskaite

customer_reviews.title: Best way to do pet nails
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than a Dremel. The thinner body makes it much easier to hold on to and easier to control while grinding the nails.
customer_reviews.author: K. Glaes

customer_reviews.title: Poor Results at High Speeds
customer_reviews.text: This product works well at low speeds but when you use it on high speed and try to grind a dog's nails, it slows down considerably. Motor needs more torque! I returned this product and purchased a Dremel variable speed 35000RPM model that works great! Amazon is GREAT about processing returns and ensuring the customer is satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Retired Army Officer

customer_reviews.title: A good grinder
customer_reviews.text: It worked well my dogs hate nail clippers and this is a good option. The only problem is if you get behind on the nails you still have to use a clipper, the grinder doesn't have enough power to remove a lot of material.
customer_reviews.author: gardenwagon

customer_reviews.title: 5 yrs of service out of our last one.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for a 5 yr old one that the bearings started to go out on. 3 dog household (1 Saint Bernard and 2 German Shepherd s.)
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: The unit performs as advertised. No complaints. Still getting used to it but it is easy to use, the wire is long enough to gain position and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh B. MacLeod

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Been using this on out puppy for a month now. Even if not needed, I use it on her once a week to make sure she sees this as a normal action. Its also nice to know I am not risking cutting her too deep like you would with clippers.
customer_reviews.author: brandeeno

customer_reviews.title: horrible
customer_reviews.text: The sandpaper rolls that you attach to the head spin around as you try to file your pet's nails!! Cheapest piece of equipment I have ever ordered. I was afraid to use it for fear that the pieces would fly off and hit us in the eyes. I already own a dremel trimmer that needed a new battery pack. I foolishly thought this one would be better since it cost more and was a plug in tool. Wow! Was I mistaken!! Very frustrated with Entirely Pets as they will only give me "in store" credit. Yeah, like I'll be doing that!! I'll take it back to Petsmart and see what they can do! Never again!!!
customer_reviews.author: rah

customer_reviews.title: not worth the time
customer_reviews.text: it stoped working after a couple of weeks. and this is the second time iv had one of these. the top comes off easy and the speed is from super low to freakishy fast i wouldnt reccomend this one
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I recommended 100% this item
customer_reviews.text: I have three dogs. I recommended 100% this item, but I had to really training before used with my dogs. Now I feel comfortable with it and my dogs also.
customer_reviews.author: Pet’s Lover

product_meta.title: Oster Professional Corded Pet Nail Grinder Kit, Variable Speed (078129-650-000)
product_meta.description: Masterfully groom your dog’s nails with the Oster Professional Corded Pet Nail Grinder Kit. Equipped with a variable-speed motor, this electric nail grinder provides the power needed to precisely file pets’ nails--even the large, tough ones of big dogs. Its Whisper-Quiet, low-torque motor minimizes noise output to help keep animals calm during the grooming session. Designed for ultra-safe operation, the nail grinder features finger grips for improved control and safer operation. It comes with everything you need for professional nail grinding results, including two 60-grit grooming bands, two 100-grit grooming bands, a grooming drum, a grinding stone, a power supply, and an instructions manual.
feature_bullets: Nail grinder kit provides a safe, effective way to trim your dog’s nails
Variable-speed motor delivers power for grinding a wide variety of nail types
Whisper-quiet operation helps keep animals calm during grooming process
Lightweight design with auto-stop safety feature and finger grips for easier, safer operation
Includes two 60-grit grooming bands, two 100-grit grooming bands, grooming drum, grinding stone, power supply, and instructions manual
